# Draft:List of awards and nominations received by Sammi Cheng

Sammi Cheng is a Hong Kong singer and actress who has accumulated a substantial number of accolades and nominations throughout her career in both music and film. She is widely regarded as one of Hong Kong’s preeminent female artists, having garnered extensive recognition from industry peers and award institutions.

| YesAsia 2014 Bestsellers Award
|  2014
| "Love Is Love" (愛就是愛)
| Ranked No. 6 among the Top 10 BEST-SELLING C-POP ALBUMS (十大暢銷華語專輯第六位)
|
| style="font-size:smaller;" | Since this album was released on December 23, 2013, but the sales chart counts sales only from January 1 to December 30, 2014, it missed out on a week of sales. Additionally, this album had fewer editions compared to the female artist ranked fifth. Therefore, it did not become the best-selling album by a female artist on that platform for the year. However, when averaging sales across different editions, its performance was comparable. Sammi Cheng’s album "Love is Love" had only two editions and ranked sixth, while another female artist’s album with seven editions narrowly secured the fifth position.
| style="text-align:center"|

Jade Solid Gold Best 10 Awards Presentation
In the 1990s, Television Broadcasts Limited (TVB) in Hong Kong conducted the Jade Solid Gold Selections every three months, selecting approximately ten winning songs from a pool of numerous nominees. These selections subsequently qualified as contenders for the annual Jade Solid Gold Best Ten Music Awards Presentation, a prominent local music accolade held by TVB each January. Award determination involved both public voting and deliberation by a professional judging panel. Throughout the 1990s, the "Most Popular Female/Male Artist Awards" and the "Gold Song Gold Award" were considered the highest distinctions at the ceremony.The "Gold Song Gold Award" was conferred upon a single song chosen from the ten winners, with criteria encompassing voter support, year-round popularity, musical composition, lyrical merit, and vocal performance. Accordingly, the "Gold Song Gold Award" was recognized for affirming both the artistic merit of the song and the singer's vocal prowess. The following is a summary of Sammi Cheng’s awards from 1993 to 2002:

Sky Music Awards Presentation
One of the early music awards reflecting public opinion, the results were determined by both song airplay and voting rates.  However, since 2002, the awards experienced a decline in popularity and credibility. Although Sammi Cheng became active again in the Hong Kong music scene in 2009 and won 3 Awards at it,  their influence remained limited, reflecting mainly the preferences of a niche audience. By 2013, it officially came to an end due to waning public interest.

Yes!Hong Kong Pop Song Chart Awards
In view of the fact that music industry award ceremonies have traditionally sought to balance the interests of singers and record companies—thereby failing to fully reflect public opinion—and given the lack of a definitive popular music poll in previous magazine publications, this initiative was established to objectively gauge and represent the preferences of the younger generation.

Singapore Hit Awards
The Singapore Hit Awards have faced criticism for awarding what was dubbed the "Worthless Awards," with accusations of predetermined winners and bias favoring artists under the PolyGram label. Furthermore, the Singapore Hit Awards 1997  was suspended due to uncontrollable circumstances, during which  Sammi Cheng was a strong contender for The Most Popular Female Artiste and the Best-selling album award with her debut Mandarin album "Worth It".
A major flaw in the Singapore Hit Awards’ system was the restrictive eligibility period for nominations,which led to Sammi Cheng missing several nomination opportunities.
For example, the  Singapore Hit Awards 1999 , held in November, considered only SPVA sales chart Performance and YES 933 Pick Of The Pops Chart Performance from June 15, 1998, to June 13, 1999. Consequently, although Sammi’s Mandarin album I Deserved  was released on May 10, 1999, and enjoyed significant commercial success—including six weeks at number one on the SPVA sales chart
and over five months on the charts—it fell outside the effective counting period. This disqualified her from nominations for Most Popular Female Artiste and Best-Selling Album despite strong sales ,the songs from the album performed well on the YES 933 Pick Of The Pops Chart . Moreover, sales during this excluded interval could not be carried over to the following year’s Best-Selling Album awards, highlighting a systemic weakness in the award's eligibility rules.

China
Sammi Cheng has rarely developed her career in Mainland China but has still received some music awards there. However, she seldom attends the award ceremonies. It should be noted that most music awards in Mainland China are controversial in terms of credibility, with many considered lacking real value. Fortunately, the CCTV-MTV Music Award for Best Female Artist in Hong Kong is regarded as relatively more prestigious. Sammi Cheng won this award for three consecutive years and did attend to receive it. However, subsequent recipients from some record labels were involved in bribery scandals,  which undermined the award’s credibility.
